creator: wfelipe@gmail.com
text:
Hello,

The response header ETag differs using different architectures to serve the same content. The FileETag configuration used was:

FileETag MTime Size

x86_64 binaries, the ETag is:
ETag: "a-4523af1041500"

and on i386 binaries:
ETag: "a-f1041500"

========================

I tested on 3 httpd's:
- httpd 2.2.8 (it also happens on 2.2.9), compiled for x86_64
GET /413.html HTTP/1.0
Host: test.wb.uol.com.br

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Thu, 24 Jul 2008 14:22:00 GMT
Server: Apache/2.2.8
Last-Modified: Thu, 17 Jul 2008 16:43:32 GMT
ETag: "a-4523af1041500"
Accept-Ranges: bytes
Content-Length: 10
Cache-Control: max-age=315360000
Expires: Sun, 22 Jul 2018 14:22:00 GMT
Connection: close
Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1

- httpd 2.0.63, compiled for x86_64
GET /413.html HTTP/1.0
Host: test.wb.uol.com.br

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Thu, 24 Jul 2008 14:41:57 GMT
Server: Apache/2.0.63
Last-Modified: Thu, 17 Jul 2008 16:43:32 GMT
ETag: "a-4523af1041500"
Accept-Ranges: bytes
Content-Length: 10
Cache-Control: max-age=315360000
Expires: Sun, 22 Jul 2018 14:41:57 GMT
Connection: close
Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1

- httpd 2.0.63, compiled for i386
GET /413.html HTTP/1.0
Host: test.wb.uol.com.br

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Date: Thu, 24 Jul 2008 14:22:09 GMT
Server: Apache/2.0.63
Last-Modified: Thu, 17 Jul 2008 16:43:32 GMT
ETag: "a-f1041500"
Accept-Ranges: bytes
Content-Length: 10
Cache-Control: max-age=315360000
Expires: Sun, 22 Jul 2018 14:22:09 GMT
Connection: close
Content-Type: text/html; charset=ISO-8859-1

========================

is that the correct behavior?

creator: rpluem@apache.org
text: This smells like PR40064. Are you sure that you use 2.2.9 and not something below 2.2.7?

creator: wfelipe@gmail.com
text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> This smells like PR40064. Are you sure that you use 2.2.9 and not something
> below 2.2.7?
> 

I tried to find a similar bug before I posted the bug but I couldn't find, and I found it later. I tested 2.2.9 on x86_64 and it shows the longer etag, on 32-bit it also shows longer etag as well, so 2.2.9 is not a problem.

I changed the version in the bug report to 2.0.63, because it still happens

creator: wfelipe@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 22317
patch to use apr_uint64_t for etags in 2.0 branch

patch to fix etags in 2.0 branch

I've just rewritten the patch for 2.0 branch submitted by Joe Orton:
https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/attachment.cgi?id=18635

(In reply to comment #3)
> Created an attachment (id=22317) [details]
> patch to use apr_uint64_t for etags in 2.0 branch
> 
> patch to fix etags in 2.0 branch
> 
> I've just rewritten the patch for 2.0 branch submitted by Joe Orton:
> https://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/attachment.cgi?id=18635
> 

changing status to assigned
creator: wfelipe@gmail.com
